CommonPage.BodyCopy:
Layout



Remember that all design must be approved by your Communication Council Department representative prior to printing and/or distribution.


It is important to create a level of consistency in the communication that comes from BYU-Idaho by following the visualidentityguidelines. But this still leaves plenty of freedom in communicating your message.


Provided templates

Templates have been provided for most communication mediums. Print templates are provided in Adobe InDesign or Microsoft Publisher and are built to help you produce files that will print out properly.


The level of creativity required for your communication piece is determined by who it needs to communicate to and where it will be presented. Pieces designed for an off-campus audience or to represent the university in an official capacity should be more formal than pieces to promote an on-campus, informal event aimed at students.


Appropriate imagery

Images of people must reflect BYU-Idaho Dress and Grooming Standards and be in harmony with Student Honor Policies.


Sufficient resolution

If your images are too small they will not look crisp and clean. Most images you find on the internet will not have high enough resolution. Your images must be at least 225 pixels/inch at the actual size they are printed.


The image and the type work together

Avoid placing type directly on top of an image. It is generally hard to read, making communication less effective.

Questions? Send us an e-mail: ucidentity@byui.edu
